Description: The U.S. Department of Justice, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the state of West Virginia announced that Consol Energy Inc., the largest producer of coal from underground mines in the United States, has agreed to pay a $5.5 million civil penalty for Clean Water Act violations at six of its mines in West Virginia. In addition to the penalty, Consol will spend an estimated $200 million in pollution controls that will reduce discharges of harmful mining wastewater into Appalachian streams and rivers.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/consol-energy-pay-55-million-penalty-and-install-wastewater-treatment-plant-settle-clean

Description: The Department of Justice, the EPA and the state of Pennsylvania announced that Consol Energy Inc., CNX Coal Resources and Consol Pennsylvania Coal Co. LLC agreed to implement extensive water management and monitoring activities to prevent contaminated discharges of mining wastewater from the Bailey Mine Complex in Greene and Washington Counties, Pennsylvania, to the Ohio River and its tributaries. Consol also agreed to pay a $3 million civil penalty for Clean Water Act violations.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/settlement-us-and-pennsylvania-requires-consol-energy-implement-water-management-upgrades
https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/8-27-15a.cfm
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Description: Dominion Exploration and Production Co., formerly CNG Producing Company, paid the United States $2 million to resolve claims that CNG underpaid royalties owed on natural gas that it produced on federal leases.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2003/February/03_civ_080.htm

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 212111: Bituminous Coal and Lignite Surface Mining
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
